intro: Silene stojanovii, commonly known as the Stojanov's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Silene stojanovii has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in racemes. It is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
